intro: Euphrasia ciliolata, commonly known as the fringed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairless stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to yellow, bloom in early spring, and the plant produces small, capsule-like fruits. Euphrasia ciliolata is often found in alpine and coastal habitats, where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions.
